item.title: Coronavirus: Reopening NHS services must be safe, unions say
item.description: Hospitals face another "crucial test" when outpatient clinics and operations resume, health unions say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Academy trust to open schools on 1 June
item.description: Opposition to reopening schools is "rather middle class" claims head of academy trust.

item.title: Rick Bright: 'Ousted' vaccine expert says US is facing its 'darkest winter'
item.description: The dire warning on coronavirus comes from a former top health official who says he was ousted.

item.title: Coronavirus: Amsterdam trials 'Covid-safe' restaurant
item.description: Dutch restaurants are currently closed but a trial is under way to see how they could operate safely.

item.title: Coronavirus: Avanti introduces social distancing measures on its trains
item.description: Rail firm Avanti urges passengers not to turn up without an advanced ticket and wear face coverings.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown exit plan for Wales to be published
item.description: Wales' first minister will say how he plans to lift the country out of coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus: Transport for London secures emergency £1.6bn bailout
item.description: Sadiq Khan agrees to quickly restore a full Tube service under the terms of the emergency agreement.

item.title: One in 400 people in England has coronavirus, tests suggest
item.description: The estimate is based on tests on 11,000 people from 5,000 households over the past two weeks.

item.title: Minister 'opens door' for football return
item.description: The government says it is "opening the door" for professional football in England in June, after a meeting with the FA, Premier League and EFL.

item.title: Richard Burr: Senate intelligence chief steps down for FBI probe
item.description: The Republican is suspected of using privileged details on coronavirus risks for insider trading.

item.title: Coronavirus: Mental health of NHS staff at long-term risk
item.description: Trauma experts say NHS staff are a high-risk group for PTSD in the aftermath of the pandemic.

item.title: 'Surge' in illegal bird of prey killings since lockdown
item.description: The RSPB says it has been "overrun" by reports of birds of prey being illegally killed.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Game changer' test and 19m 'may have had virus'
item.description: A study suggesting up to 19 million people in the UK may have had the virus is among the front-page stories.

item.title: Coronavirus: How a 'virtual Parliament' works
item.description: How the House of Commons has found new ways of working in the face of coronavirus.

item.title: How the super-rich spent lockdown
item.description: Luxury Bunkers and Private Islands: How the super-rich spent lockdown

item.title: Quiz of the Week: Little Richard, Project Restart and more
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Australia Fires: Rescue dog Bear saves scores of koalas
item.description: A koala-detecting dog has come to the rescue in the aftermath of Australia's fires.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK's eighth clap for carers
item.description: People across the UK show appreciation for front-line workers risking their lives during the pandemic.

item.title: Friends hug again as New Zealand opens up
item.description: New Zealand has reported no new cases of the virus in the past three days.

item.title: Coronavirus: How exposed is your job?
item.description: See how your job compares to others in terms of exposure to disease and closeness to other people.

item.title: Coronavirus: How the pandemic is relaxing US drinking laws
item.description: Many states are relaxing rules about selling alcohol to-go to accommodate Covid closures.

item.title: Coronavirus: Is Putin rushing Russia out of lockdown?
item.description: The Russian president has declared a six-week lockdown over but the infection rate is still very high.

item.title: Chennai Six: Nick Dunn reveals what Indian prison life was like
item.description: Nick Dunn spent years in prison in India for a crime he did not commit. How did he cope?

item.title: Coping with coronavirus in a war zone
item.description: How a British charity is helping war-torn Libya deal with the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why hasn't the UK listed loss of smell as a symptom of Covid-19?
item.description: Some scientists argue that it is becoming urgent to tell people with sudden loss of smell to self-isolate.

item.title: England players to return to training next week
item.description: England players will begin individual training next week in the first step to returning to action after the coronavirus shutdown.

item.title: Ferrari sign Sainz & Ricciardo goes to McLaren for 2021 Formula 1 season
item.description: Daniel Ricciardo is to race for McLaren in 2021, taking the seat of Carlos Sainz, who will move to Ferrari.

item.title: IOC sets aside $800m fund for delayed Olympics
item.description: The International Olympic Committee sets aside £654m to help with the "severe" financial impact caused by Tokyo 2020's postponement.

item.title: Friday's gossip: Silva ready to extend Man City deal
item.description: Silva willing to extend Manchester City contract, Manchester United look at Matondo as Sancho alternative, plus more.

item.title: 'Golf, babies and nervous Aussies' - The inside story of England's World T20 win
item.description: How England emerged from nowhere to rule the Twenty20 world in 2010.

item.title: Premiership clubs should have titles stripped for salary-cap breaches, says review
item.description: Premiership clubs who breach the salary cap in future should be stripped of titles and face suspensions, according to a damning review of the rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will the Covid-19 alert system work?
item.description: The threat of Covid-19 in England is to be ranked through a five-level, colour-coded alert system.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: How much will it cost the UK?
item.description: The pandemic will cost the government hundreds of billions of pounds. Where will it all come from?

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Boris Johnson has announced changes to guidelines in England on exercise and social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will I be able to go on holiday?
item.description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Am I allowed to move house?
item.description: The easing of lockdown will affect those who want to buy or sell a home, or rent somewhere new, in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: What powers do the police have?
item.description: Police across the UK now have wide-ranging powers to help fight the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: What should I do to stop the virus spreading?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Can university students get a fee refund?
item.description: Can university students get a fee refund? and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: How reopened schools in Denmark keep children safely apart
item.description: What's it like in a school that has re-opened? Denmark and Germany show how it might look.

item.title: Coronavirus bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: "Bubbles" of people we can meet safely may form part of the plans to ease lockdown in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on public transport?
item.description: Bus and train operators are reducing services and increasing cleaning.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does lockdown easing 'follow the science'?
item.description: Why is England pressing ahead with plans to ease lockdown rules ahead of the rest of the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

item.title: How do I travel to work now?
item.description: Some people are being encouraged to go back to work, but how will they get there?

item.title: How to make your own face mask
item.description: Our guide to different types of face coverings and step-by-step instructions on how to make them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do I have to go back to work after lockdown?
item.description: With lockdown restrictions eased, people may start going back to work. But what are your rights?

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask or face covering?
item.description: For the first time, people in England are being advised to wear face coverings in some situations.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will schools reopen?
item.description: Schools have been closed to most pupils since the end of March - when and how will they open?

item.title: Coronavirus R0: What is the R number and why does it matter?
item.description: Experts keep discussing the value of R, but what is it and why does it matter?

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the UK's test, track and trace strategy?
item.description: A guide to the three key parts of the government's coronavirus strategy after lockdowns are eased.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown is being lifted across Europe
item.description: As the UK alters its restrictions, how do other European countries plan to re-open after lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: Labour's Starmer says PM statement 'raises as many questions as answers'
item.description: People are being told to go back to work without clear safety guidance, Labour leader Keir Starmer says.

item.title: Jorge Masvidal: UFC fighter's rise from Miami street fighting scene
item.description: Jorge Masvidal started out fighting in the shadows, in Miami's hidden yards and parking lots. Now he's reached the riches of the UFC.
